result.execSummary:
The defendant Jelani H Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at $0.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving the first 9 months of sentence and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing. 
No contact with LT and Raven D.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jelani H Spencer

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 720-3629,  and mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729.  jm
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP, signed.

DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  As Br. 23 is not in session, case assigned to to pair court, Br. 34, Judge Yamahiro.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jelani H Spencer in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jelani H Spencer in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charge and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving the first 9 months of sentence and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with LT and Raven D.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Jelani H Spencer in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Original information received and filed amending charge to Burglary (Building or Dwelling), pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 943.10(1m)(a) a Class F Felony.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.

Defense counsel informed the court that the the defendant's revocation hearing got postponed and thus the plea and sentencing scheduled for tomorrow will not be able to proceed. The State does does not object to a new date. Plea and sentencing is now scheduled for 07/29/2015 at 8:30 in Branch 21.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Jelani H Spencer not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jelani H Spencer in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jelani H Spencer in custody.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Raven D.   AND/OR   Liyen T.   AND/OR  their places of residence   AND/OR  their places of employment or school
AND/OR  the address of 2844 North 51st Street, City of Milwaukee

Defendant Jelani H Spencer in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jelani H Spencer in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
